metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6521 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Side-channel information leakage in autofill in Google Chrome prior to 84.0.4147.89 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
